content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace at (0.0, 0.0) producing {'iron-plate': 43} (warning: no ingredients to smelt)  
– Iron Chest at (1.5, 0.5)  
Use-case: Primary smelting station for converting raw materials into iron plates.

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at (–16.0, –51.0)
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill at (–16.0, –51.0) (warnings: out of fuel, output blocked by item on the ground)  
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –49.5) (warning: out of fuel)  
– Iron Chest at (–13.5, –49.5) holding {'iron-ore': 146}  
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –47.5) (status: WAITING_FOR_SOURCE_ITEMS)  
– Fast Inserter at (–12.5, –49.5) (warning: not receiving electricity)  
– Fast Inserter at (–13.5, –45.5) (warning: not connected to power network)  
Use-case: Extraction and initial transport of iron ore for further processing.

### Copper Furnace at (–27.0, –60.0)
Consists of:
– Furnace at (–27.0, –60.0) actively supplied with copper ore (20 units) and producing 40 copper plates  
Use-case: Processes copper ore into copper plates for advanced manufacturing.

### Lab Power Integration System at (0.5, 2.5)
Consists of:
– Lab at (0.5, 2.5) with lab_input {'automation-science-pack': 23}  
– Offshore Pump at (–7.5, 25.5)  
– Offshore Pump at (–9.5, 24.5) (connected to the Boiler)  
– Boiler at (2.0, 17.5) fueled with 10 coal (warnings: no input liquid, no fluid present in connections)  
– Steam Engine at (11.5, 27.5) (newly relocated; fluid connection via underground piping remains unresolved)  
Use-case: Supports lab operations through integrated power and fluid systems despite persisting connectivity issues.

### Copper Cable Factory at (2.5, 6.5)
Consists of:
– Repositioned Assembling Machine at (2.5, 6.5) configured with the Copper Cable recipe (moved from (3.5, 0.5))  
– Small Electric Pole at (4.5, 6.5) supplying power to the facility  
– Stone Furnace at (6.0, 7.0) placed adjacent to the Assembling Machine for smelting Copper Ore into Copper Plates  
Use-case: Produces Copper Cables from smelted Copper Plates; production is hindered by recurrent output extraction issues.

### Fluid Pipelines (Multiple Pipe Groups)
Consists of:
– Multiple PipeGroups spanning positions such as (–10.5, 22.5) to (–9.5, 23.5); groups at (8.5, 5.5), (10.5, 4.5), (–9.5, 24.5) to the Boiler, (2.5, 9.5), (10.5, 9.5), (1.5, 11.5), (–1.5, 17.5), (0.5, 17.5), (6.5, 16.5), (–1.5, 21.5) and (4.5, 25.5)  
Use-case: Transports fluids between production components; connectivity issues persist between the Boiler and Steam Engine.

### Integrated Components
Consists of:
– BeltGroup connecting inserter and belt outputs (6 belts total)  
– Electricity network via:  
 • ElectricityGroup (id=57159) with poles at [(-10.5, -49.5), (-12.5, -48.5), (-12.5, -50.5)]  
 • ElectricityGroup (id=57162) near (3.5, 0.5)  
 • ElectricityGroup (id=57172) with poles at [(6.5, 3.5), (5.5, 8.5)]  
 • ElectricityGroup (id=57174) with poles at [(2.5, 30.5), (7.5, 26.5)]  
Use-case: Provides overall material handling via belts and supports factory operations with an extensive power network.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Underground Fluid Connection Failures  
 – Ensure that both the source and target connection points (e.g., between the Boiler at (2.0, 17.5) and the Steam Engine at (11.5, 27.5)) are unobstructed and have matching fluid flow parameters. Adjust layouts to alleviate congestion near critical connections (such as around (2.5, 21.5)).

• Offshore Pump and Electronic Component Crafting Failures  
 – Verify that all sub-ingredients (like copper cables and copper plates) are sufficiently available to support downstream crafting. Consolidate resource flows to prevent unmet ingredient errors.

• Entity Placement and Collision Issues  
 – Multiple failures occurred when placing Small Electric Poles adjacent to the Copper Cable Assembling Machine at target positions (e.g., (5.5, 0.5), (6.5, 0.5), (3.5, -1.5), (3.5, 2.5), (3.5, 3.5)). Similarly, attempts to place a Stone Furnace near (2.5, 6.5) failed due to collision at (6, 6.5). Ensure target tiles are free and adjust spacing, direction, or reference positions accordingly before placement.

• Component Extraction Failures  
 – Repeated failures to extract Copper Cable from the Assembling Machine (both at the original location (3.5, 0.5) and after repositioning to (2.5, 6.5)) indicate the need to confirm that production is complete and that a valid output entity is present prior to extraction.

• Repositioning and Buildable Area Computation Errors  
 – Errors such as the TypeError stating that a 'Position' object is not callable highlight the importance of treating Position objects as data structures. Validate buildable area computations and avoid invoking such objects as functions.

• Resource Insertion and Availability Issues  
 – Errors inserting Copper Plates into the new Assembling Machine (due to lack of inventory) underscore the necessity of monitoring resource levels closely and ensuring that required inputs are stocked before triggering production.

• Fuel and Resource Insertion Issues  
 – Past errors (e.g., failure to insert coal into the Boiler) remind operators to proactively monitor and replenish critical resources to maintain continuous production.

• Removal Operation and Relocation Computation Errors  
 – Ensure entities exist and that their data types are correctly handled when performing removals or positional computations to avoid TypeErrors related to NoneType or improper use of Position objects.
